name: underutilize
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to not use something or someone as much as it or they could or should be used: This new plan identifies some of the sectors where we underutilize the information that we already have. The movie was criticized for underutilizing a talented cast.
More examplesFewer examplesThe funds are available because a voluntary early retirement scheme is being underutilized.Smart assistants are being underutilized by consumers, as they prefer to use these devices for entertainment purposes as opposed to assisting with everyday tasks.He said it was obvious that doctors were underutilizing the therapy in many patients who met the criteria.These venues are spectacular, unique assets known the world over and yet historically they have been largely underutilized. A community cannot afford to under-utilise half its population.
